summary: Email correspondence between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim and AUSA Mark Cohen regarding Maxwell's conditions of confinement at the MDC. The email chain details Sternheim's complaints about restrictive conditions, surveillance, and mail delays, with Cohen providing responses from MDC legal counsel refuting or explaining many of the claims.

events.title: MDC Lockdown Conditions
events.description: MDC inmates in general population have been permitted out of their cells for no more than 30 minutes per day due to a lockdown at the institution for approximately the past month.

events.title: Certified Mail Delivery Issue
events.description: Certified mail with return receipts indicating delivery to MDC on December 17, 2020, was not received by Ghislaine Maxwell according to her attorney.

events.title: Blanket Removal Incident
events.description: During the holiday weekend, a third blanket was removed from Ghislaine Maxwell's cell, leaving her cold, and was returned the next day after complaint by counsel.

locations: West 19th Street office (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, currently closed due to COVID-19)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was receiving more favorable treatment than other MDC inmates, with 13 hours per day out of her cell compared to 30 minutes for general population inmates during lockdown.
Maxwell was the only inmate in the entire MDC institution permitted to have three blankets in her cell.
MDC legal counsel confirmed that staff cannot see Maxwell when she showers and do not record her, with two shower curtains covering her such that only her feet are visible.
Maxwell's cell searches occur no more than once per day on weekdays only, and staff do not read her legal papers according to MDC counsel.
The email reveals ongoing tensions between Maxwell's defense team and prison authorities regarding her conditions of confinement during the pandemic.
